section.section:
A court may remove a fiduciary who has:
Negligently failed to file a bond within the time required by rule or order of court;
Negligently failed to obey an order of court; or
Failed to perform any of his duties as fiduciary, or to competently administer the fiduciary estate.

text.section: Procedures for the removal of a fiduciary shall be conducted by the court in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Rules applying to a fiduciary.
The provisions of this section shall not apply to personal representatives.
